skill.name: arboreto
skill.description: Infer gene regulatory networks (GRNs) from gene expression data using scalable algorithms (GRNBoost2, GENIE3). Use when analyzing transcriptomics data (bulk RNA-seq, single-cell RNA-seq) to identify transcription factor-target gene relationships and regulatory interactions. Supports distributed computation for large-scale datasets.
skill.summary: Infer gene regulatory networks (GRNs) from gene expression data using scalable algorithms (GRNBoost2...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The skill is primarily documentation plus a local Python script for GRN inference. It reads and writes user-specified files and includes guidance for optional remote Dask connections, which introduces limited exposure.

low_findings.title: Reads and writes user-specified files
low_findings.description: The script reads input and writes output based on user-provided paths: "expression_data = pd.read_csv(expression_file, sep='\t')" and "network.to_csv(output_file, sep='\t', index=False, header=False)". This is expected for data processing but could expose sensitive files if a user passes unintended paths.

low_findings.title: Optional remote Dask connections
low_findings.description: Documentation includes connecting to a remote scheduler: "scheduler_address = 'tcp://10.118.224.134:8786'". If used, expression data can traverse the network, so users should trust and secure the cluster.

content.user_title: Infer gene regulatory networks with Arboreto
content.value_statement: You need to map transcription factor to target gene relationships from expression data. This skill guides Arboreto runs and produces clear GRN outputs.
actual_capabilities: Load TSV expression matrices and report dataset shape
Run GRNBoost2 inference with optional transcription factor lists
Set a random seed for reproducible GRN results
Save TF target importance networks to TSV output
Print top regulatory links for quick review
limitations: Requires Arboreto and Python dependencies to be installed
Input data must use genes as columns in a TSV file
The provided script runs GRNBoost2 only, not GENIE3
No normalization, quality control, or downstream regulon analysis

use_cases.title: Map cell type regulators
use_cases.description: Infer GRNs from single-cell expression matrices to identify candidate regulators for each cell type.

use_cases.title: Compare GRNs by condition
use_cases.description: Run GRNBoost2 across multiple conditions to compare regulatory links in treatment versus control data.

use_cases.title: Run standard GRN jobs
use_cases.description: Use the script to run consistent GRN inference for multiple user datasets.

prompt_templates.title: Run a basic GRN
prompt_templates.scenario: New user with a TSV matrix
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to run the basic GRN script on expression_data.tsv and save results to network.tsv with default settings.

prompt_templates.title: Use a TF list
prompt_templates.scenario: User has a TF list file
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide the command to run GRNBoost2 with expression_data.tsv and tf_list.txt and save output to tf_network.tsv.

prompt_templates.title: Set a seed
prompt_templates.prompt: Give the command to run the script with seed 123 and save the output to network_seed123.tsv.

prompt_templates.title: Scale with Dask
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how to connect Arboreto to a remote Dask scheduler and run GRNBoost2 on a large dataset.

output_examples.input: Run the script on rnaseq.tsv with tf_list.txt and seed 777, then summarize the output.
output: Loaded expression matrix with 12,000 genes and 3,000 samples
Saved network.tsv with TF, target, and importance columns
Top links show high importance scores for key regulators

best_practices: Confirm genes are columns and samples are rows before inference
Provide a curated TF list to reduce runtime and noise
Record the seed and parameters for reproducibility
anti_patterns: Running without the main guard in multiprocessing environments
Using unfiltered high dimensional data without resource planning
Treating importance scores as direct causal proof

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance and script can be used in all three platforms.

faq.question: What dataset sizes are supported?
faq.answer: Small datasets run locally. Large datasets may require Dask and more memory.

faq.question: Can I integrate it into an existing pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes. The script and examples are designed for Python workflows.

faq.question: Does it access private data or credentials?
faq.answer: No. It only reads the files you specify and writes outputs you choose.

faq.question: What should I do if inference is slow?
faq.answer: Use GRNBoost2, filter genes, provide TF lists, or configure a Dask client.

faq.question: How does it compare to other GRN tools?
faq.answer: It provides GRNBoost2 and GENIE3, which are standard and widely used algorithms.
